meanings.definition: The act of making excessive or exaggerated predictions based on limited data or evidence.
meanings.sent1: Her overextrapolations about the future of the company were proven wrong when the actual results came in.
meanings.sent2: The scientist's overextrapolations from a single study led to misleading conclusions.
meanings.sent3: His overextrapolations about winning the lottery every week were quite amusing to his friends.
meanings.sent4: The politician's overextrapolations about the economy crashing caused unnecessary panic among the citizens.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used overextrapolations to explain the concept, but it only confused the students further.
